description: Grafana Dashboard for Veeam Backup for Azure v7 -  (Grafana 11.x / InfluxDB v2.x)

panels.description: Displays the total number of unique servers with Veeam backup policies in Azure, providing a quick overview of backup coverage.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_policies")
  |> keep(columns: ["serverName"])
  |> distinct(column: "serverName")
  |> group()
  |> count()

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_repositories")
  |> keep(columns: ["repoName"])
  |> distinct(column: "repoName")
  |> group()
  |> count()

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMs")
  |> last()
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ _value: r._value }))

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "DBs")
  |> last()
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ _value: r._value }))

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "fileSharesTotalCount")
  |> last()
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ _value: r._value }))

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "vb")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({_value: r.version}))
  |> yield(name: "version")

panels.title: Veeam Backup for Azure Overview

panels.description:
On this Map, you can quickly know which VMs are not Protected by Veeam Backup for Azure. 
With a simple, yet powerful view, you can understand and try to mitigate the red spots.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_vm_unprotected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "UPVM" and r._value >=1)
  |> group(columns: ["geohash","VMRegion"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Unprotected VMs

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => 
    r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_vm_protected" and r["_field"] == "TotalVMs" or
    r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview" and (r["_field"] == "DBsProtected" or r["_field"] == "fileSharesProtectedCount")
  )
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> group()
  |> sum(column: "_value")
  |> yield(name: "total_protected_workloads")

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) =>
    r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_vm_unprotected" and r["_field"] == "TotalVMs" or
    r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_overview" and (r["_field"] == "DBs" or r["_field"] == "DBsProtected" or r["_field"] == "fileSharesTotalCount" or r["_field"] == "fileSharesProtectedCount")
  )
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> pivot(rowKey: ["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({
    r with 
    unprotectedVMs: if exists r.TotalVMs then float(v: r.TotalVMs) else 0.0,
    unprotectedDBs: if exists r.DBs and exists r.DBsProtected then float(v: r.DBs) - float(v: r.DBsProtected) else 0.0,
    unprotectedFileShares: if exists r.fileSharesTotalCount and exists r.fileSharesProtectedCount then float(v: r.fileSharesTotalCount) - float(v: r.fileSharesProtectedCount) else 0.0
  }))
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({
    r with 
    totalUnprotected: r.unprotectedVMs + r.unprotectedDBs + r.unprotectedFileShares
  }))
  |> group()
  |> sum(column: "totalUnprotected")
  |> yield(name: "total_unprotected_workloads")

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly know how much time did a Backup, or Snapshot Policy take. You can quickly filter by Policy Name on the top menu.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_sessions")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sessionDuration")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionType"] =~ /${PolicyType:regex}/)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionPolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["sessionPolicyName","sessionType"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Job Duration

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_sessions")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sessionStatus")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionPolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["sessionPolicyName","sessionType"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly know which VMs are Protected by Veeam Backup for Azure. With all the needed details as VM Name, Operating System, Azure Region, and Azure Instance Type.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_vm")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMSize")
  |> group(columns: ["VMName","VMRegion","VMType","VMOSType","VMprivateIP"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Protected VMs

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly know which VMs are not Protected by Veeam Backup for Azure. With all the needed details as VM Name, Operating System, Azure Region, and Azure Instance Type.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_vm_unprotected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMSize")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["VMName"] =~ /${VMName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["VMName","VMRegion","VMType","VMOSType", "VMprivateIP"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Unprotected VMs

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly see all your Backup Repositories, with name, type, etc.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_repositories")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "repoEncryption")
  |> group(columns: ["repoAccountName","repoContainer","repoDescription","repoName","RepositoryTier"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Backup Repositories

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly see your different Policies, the retention, if it has application-aware enabled, etc.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_policies")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "PolicyAppAware" or r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountDaily" or r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountWeekly" or r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountMonthly" )
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["PolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> pivot(rowKey:["_time"], columnKey:["_field"], valueColumn:"_value")
  |> group(columns: ["PolicyName","_field"])

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_policies")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountDaily")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["PolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["PolicyName","PolicyStatus"])
  |> last()

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_policies")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountWeekly")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["PolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["PolicyName","PolicyStatus"])
  |> last()

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_policies")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCountMonthly")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["PolicyName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["PolicyName","PolicyStatus"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Protection Policies

list.definition:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_azure_sessions")
  |> keep(columns: ["sessionPolicyName"])
  |> distinct(column: "sessionPolicyName")
  |> group()
list.label: Policy Name
list.name: PolicyName
